data.title: 50 TV Theme Songs That Made the Billboard Charts: Listen
data.meta_description: As the new TV fall season gets under way, we take a look back at 50 TV theme songs that not only opened shows, but became Billboard chart hits.
data.text:
As the new TV fall season gets under way, we take a look back at 50 TV theme songs that not only opened shows, but became Billboard chart hits.

As the new TV fall season gets under way, we take a look back at 50 TV theme songs that not only opened shows, but became Billboard chart hits.

As the new TV fall season gets under way, we take a look back at 50 TV theme songs that not only opened shows, but became Billboard chart hits. From the late ’50s through today, with the TV theme heyday lasting roughly through the mid-’90s, TV and music have often intertwined on our tallies. From Batman to Smallville, Hawaii Five-O to Hannah Montana, and Friends to The Ellen DeGeneres Show, we rerun 50 TV themes that have also scaled the Billboard charts.

TV Theme Songs That Made the Billboard Charts

As the new TV fall season gets under way, we take a look back at 50 TV theme songs that not only opened shows, but became Billboard chart hits. From the late ’50s through today, with the TV theme heyday lasting roughly through the mid-’90s, TV and music have often intertwined on our tallies. From Batman to Smallville, Hawaii Five-O to Hannah Montana, and Friends to The Ellen DeGeneres Show, we rerun 50 TV themes that have also scaled the Billboard charts.

Theme Song Title: ‘Peter Gunn’

Peter Gunn: Craig Stevens, Lola Albright

Theme Song Title: ‘Bonanza’

Bonanza: Dan Blocker (as Hoss Cartwright), Lorne Greene (as Ben Cartwright), Michael Landon (as Little Joe Cartwright)

Theme Song Title: ‘Theme From Ben Casey’

TV Show: Ben Casey (1961-1966)

Artist: Valjean (on piano)

Chart Peak: No. 10, Adult Contemporary, 1962<

Click here to listen to our Spotify playlist of TV theme songs that charted.

Theme Song Title: ‘Theme From Dr. Kildare (Three Stars Will Shine Tonight)’

Dr. Kildare: Richard Chamberlain (as Dr. James Kildare)

Theme Song Title: ‘The Ballad of Jed Clampett’

The Beverly Hillbillies: Donna Douglas, Irene Ryan; (bottom) Buddy Ebsen, Max Baer

Theme Song Title: ‘Secret Agent Man’

Secret Agent: Madeleine Carroll, Peter Lorre, John Gielgud

Theme Song Title: ‘Batman Theme’

Batman: Burt Ward (as Richard “Dick” Grayson/Robin The Boy Wonder), Adam West (as Bruce N. Wayne/Batman)

Theme Song Title: ‘Mission: Impossible’

Mission: Impossible: Greg Morris, Steven Hill, Barbara Bain, Peter Lupus

Theme Song Title: ‘With a Little Help From My Friends’

The Wonder Years: Jason Hervey (as Wayne Arnold), Alley Mills (as Norma Arnold), Olivia d’Abo (as Karen Arnold), Fred Savage (as Kevin Arnold), Dan Lauria (as Jack Arnold)

Theme Song Title: ‘Hawaii Five-O’

HAWAII FIVE-0, Jack Lord, 1968-80.

Theme Song Title: ‘Those Were the Days’

All in the Family cast photo featuring Jean Stapleton and Carroll O’Connor. Negative dated October 24, 1972.

Theme Song Title: ‘The Rockford Files’

The Rockford Files: Claudette Nevins, James Garner, Ed Nelson, Donna Baccala in ‘Trouble In Chapter 17’.

Theme Song Title: ‘Theme From S.W.A.T.’

S.W.A.T.: Steve Forrest, Mark Shea, Rod Perry, James Coleman, Robert Urich, 1975-76

Theme Song Title: ‘Baretta’s Theme (Keep Your Eye on the Sparrow)’

Baretta: Robert Blake (as Det. Tony Baretta)

Theme Song Title: ‘Happy Days’

Happy Days: Scott Baio (as Charles ‘Chachi’ Arcola), Anson Williams (as Warren ‘Potsie’ Weber), Ron Howard (as Richard ‘Richie’ Cunningham), Henry Winkler (as Arthur ‘Fonzie’ Fonzarelli), Don Most (as Ralph Malph)

Theme Song Title: ‘Making Our Dreams Come True’

Laverne & Shirley: Cindy Williams, Penny Marshall

Theme Song Title: ‘Welcome Back ‘

Welcome Back Kotter: Ron Palillo, Robert Hegyes, Lawrence Hilton-Jacobs, Gabe Kaplan, John Travolta, 1975-79

Theme Song Title: ‘(Theme From) Charlie’s Angels’

Charlie’s Angels: Jaclyn Smith (as Kelly Garrett), Kate Jackson (as Sabrina Duncan), Farrah Fawcett (as Jill Munroe)

Theme Song Title: ‘Theme From Starsky & Hutch’

Starsky and Hutch: Paul Michael Glaser, David Soul, 1975-79.

Theme Song Title: ‘Makin’ It’

TV show: Makin’ It (1979)

Artist: David Naughton

Chart Peak: No. 5, Hot 100, 1979

Click here to listen to our Spotify playlist of TV theme songs that charted.

Theme Song Title: ‘Different Worlds’

Angie, from left: Susan Duvall, Nancy Lane, Valri Bromfield, Donna Pescow, Anne De Salvo in ‘Angie’s Old Friends’.

Theme Song Title: ‘Theme From The Dukes of Hazzard (Good Ol’ Boys)’

Dukes of Hazzard: Catherine Bach (as Daisy Duke), John Schneider (as Bo Duke), Tom Wopat (as Luke Duke)

Theme Song Title: ‘Theme From Love Boat’

The Love Boat: Bernie Kopell, Lauren Tewes, Gavin MacLeod, Ted Lange, Fred Grandy

Theme Song Title: ‘WKRP in Cincinnati’

WKRP in Cincinnati: Richard Sanders (as Les Nessman); Frank Bonner (as Herb Tarlek); Gordon Jump (as Arthur Carlson, ‘Big Guy’); Loni Anderson (as Jennifer Marlow), sitting on lap of: Howard Hesseman (as Johnny Caravella ‘Dr. Johnny Fever’); Gary Sandy (as Andy Travis); Tim Reid (as Gordon Sims, ‘Venus Flytrap); and Jan Smithers (as Bailey Quarters).

Theme Song Title: ‘The Theme From Hill Street Blues’

Hill Street Blues: Michael Warren as Officer Bobby Hill, Ed Marinaro as Officer Joe Coffey, Charles Haid as Officer Andrew ‘Andy’ Renko

Theme Song Title: ‘Theme From Greatest American Hero (Believe It or Not)’

The Greatest American Hero: Connie Sellecca, William Katt, Robert Culp

Theme Song Title: ‘Theme From Dynasty’

Dynasty: (back row) Gordon Thomson, John James, Catherine Oxenberg, Michael Praed, Jack Coleman, Michael Nader; (front row) Pamela Bellwood, Linda Evans, John Forsythe, Joan Collins, Diahann Carroll

Theme Song Title: ‘Theme From Magnum P.I.’

Magnum, P.I.: Tom Selleck (as Thomas Sullivan Magnum III)

Theme Song Title: ‘Where Everybody Knows Your Name (The Theme From ‘Cheers’)’

Cheers: Rhea Perlman, Nicholas Colasanto, Ted Danson

Theme Song Title: ‘Theme From St. Elsewhere’

Theme Song Title: ‘Miami Vice Theme’

Miami Vice: Don Johnson, Philip Michael Thomas, 1984-1989.

Theme Song Title: ‘Moonlighting (Theme)’

Moonlighting; 1986 Bruce Willis, Cybill Shepherd

Theme Song Title: ‘Theme From L.A. Law’

L.A. Law: (front row) Alexandra Powers (as Jane Halliday), Michael Tucker (as Stuart Markowitz), Jill Eikenberry (as Ann Kelsey), Richard A. Dysart (as Leland McKenzie), Alan Rosenberg (as Eli Levinson), Debi Mazar (as Denise Ianello); (back row) A Martinez (as Daniel Morales), Alan Rachins (as Douglas Brackman, Jr.), Larry Drake (as Benny Stulwicz), Corbin Bernsen (as Arnie Becker), Blair Underwood (as Jonathan Rollins), John Spencer (as Tommy Mullaney)

Theme Song Title: ‘As Long as We Got Each Other’

Growing Pains: Kirk Cameron (as Michael ‘Mike’ Aaron Seaver), Tracey Gold (as Carol Anne Seaver), Jeremy Miller (as Benjamin “Ben” Hubert Horatio Humphrey Seaver), bottom, Joanna Kerns (as Margaret ‘Maggie’ Katherine Malone Seaver), Alan Thicke (as Dr. Jason Roland Seaver)

Theme Song Title: ‘Falling’

Twin Peaks: Sherilyn Fenn, Kyle MacLachlan, 1990-1991.

Theme Song Title: ‘How Do You Talk to an Angel’

TV show: The Heights (1992)

Artist: The Heights

Chart Peak: No. 1 (2 weeks), Hot 100, 1992

Click here to listen to our Spotify playlist of TV theme songs that charted.

Theme Song Title: ‘Bad Boys (Theme From “Cops”)’

Theme Song Title: ‘I’ll Be There for You’

FRIENDS: David Schwimmer (as Ross Geller,) Jennifer Aniston (as Rachel Green), Courteney Cox (as Monica Geller), Matthew Perry (as Chandler Bing), Lisa Kudrow (as Phoebe Buffay), Matt LeBlanc (Joey Tribbiani)

Theme Song Title: ‘Closer to Free’

Party of Five: Matthew Fox, Neve Campbell, Lacey Chabert, Scott Wolf, Season 2 cast, 1995-1996.

Theme Song Title: ‘Searchin’ My Soul’

Ally McBeal: Courtney Thorne-Smith, Gil Bellows, Calista Flockhart, Jane Krakowski, Greg Germann, Lisa Nicole Carson, 1997-2002.

Theme Song Title: ‘Teardrop’

House: Robert Sean Leonard, Hugh Laurie, ‘Swan Song/Everybody Dies (Series Finale).

Theme Song Title: ‘X-Files Theme’

The X FIles: Gillian Anderson, David Duchovny, 1993-2002.

Theme Song Title: ‘Woke Up This Morning’

The Sopranos: Joe Pantoliano, Aida Turturro, Tony Sirico, Drea de Matteo, Michael Imperioli, Dominic Chianese, Jamie Lynn DiScala, Lorraine Bracco, Robert Iler, (front row) Steve VanSandt, Edie Falco, James Gandolfini

Theme Song Title: ‘Save Me’

Tom Welling as Clark Kent.

Theme Song Title: ‘You’ve Got Time’

Orange Is the New Black: Vicky Jeudy, Taylor Schilling, Dascha Polanco

Theme Song Title: ‘Today’s the Day’
